messages.content: Could you please help me find the form for and individual income tax return?
Of course, here is the 1040, the standard IRS form for and Individual Tax Return. [irs_forms_metadata: 1040]
What do I put in the first box?
Great question, you enter your first name and middle initial, if you have one!
I need help reporting my W-2 income.
Sure thing. Do you have your W-2 form from your employer? [irs_forms_metadata: W-2]
Yes, I do.
Great. You’ll use the numbers from Box 1 of your W-2 on line 1 of Form 1040, which reports wages, salaries, and tips.
How do I know if I can claim my child as a dependent?
Good question. Was your child under age 19 at the end of the year, or under 24 if a full-time student?
She’s 17 and lives with me.
Perfect, in that case, she qualifies as your dependent, assuming you provided more than half of her support during the year.
Should I take the standard deduction or itemize?
That depends. Do you have large expenses such as mortgage interest, state taxes, or charitable donations?
Not really, just the basics.

Then the standard deduction is usually the best choice. For 2024, it’s $14,600 for single filers and $29,200 for married filing jointly. This is assuming you're under 65, not blind, and have no dependents.
I’m divorced but have custody of my son. What filing status do I use?
Since you’re unmarried and support a qualifying child, you may be able to file as Head of Household, which often offers a larger standard deduction and better tax rates than Single.
Oh, that’s good to know.
Yes, just make sure your son lived with you more than half of the year to qualify.
I got a refund last year. Will I get one again this year?
It depends on how much tax was withheld versus how much you owe. A refund means you paid more than your liability.
I did adjust my withholding this year.
Then your refund may be smaller, or you could even owe. The best way to know is to enter your W-2 and other income documents into the 1040 and compare your tax liability to your withholding.
Could you please help me find the form for an individual income tax return?
Of course, here is the 1040, the standard IRS form for and Individual Tax Return. [irs_forms_metadata: 1040]
What do I put in the first box?
Great question, you enter your first name and middle initial, if you have one!
What about Line 1?
Line 1 is where you report your wages, salaries, tips, and other earned income, typically from your W-2.
Could you please help me find the form for a corporation income tax return?
Absolutely. The form you’re looking for is Form 1120, the U.S. Corporation Income Tax Return. [irs_forms_metadata: 1120]
Thanks. What do I put in the first box?
In the first box, labeled Name, you’ll enter the legal name of the corporation exactly as it appears in your incorporation documents.
And what about box C?
Box C is for the Business Activity Code. This is a six-digit number from the IRS instructions that best describes your corporation’s primary business activity.
I need help finding the form for corporate estimated taxes.
You’ll want Form 1120-W, the Estimated Tax for Corporations worksheet. [irs_forms_metadata: 1120-W]
What goes in Line 1?
Line 1 is for your corporation’s expected taxable income for the year. This is before any net operating loss or special deductions.
And Line 10?
Line 10 calculates your corporation’s estimated tax after credits. It’s derived from multiplying Line 9 by 21% (the flat corporate tax rate), then subtracting any allowable credits.
So this is how I figure out quarterly payments?
Exactly! Once the worksheet helps you estimate total annual tax, you divide it into four equal installments and pay quarterly.
What form do I need to file as a partnership?
Partnerships use Form 1065, the U.S. Return of Partnership Income. [irs_forms_metadata: 1065]
What goes in the “Principal business activity” box?
You’ll write a brief description of your partnership’s main activity, such as “Real estate rentals” or “Consulting services.”
And Schedule K-1?

Each partner receives a Schedule K-1, which reports their share of the partnership’s income, deductions, and credits. This is what is known as an Infromation Form/ [irs_forms_metadata: Schedule K-1 (Form 1120-S)]
How do I claim the Child Tax Credit on my return?
You’ll use Schedule 8812, which is attached to your Form 1040. [irs_forms_metadata: Schedule 8812 (Form 1040)]
Where do I put it on the 1040?
The total Child Tax Credit from Schedule 8812 flows into Line 19 of Form 1040.
Does it reduce my tax or give me a refund?
That's an interesting question. It reduces your tax owed dollar-for-dollar. If the credit is larger than your tax liability, part of it may be refundable, meaning you can receive it as a refund.
